item.title: Report: Chavez's cancer has 'entered the end stage'
item.description: Report: Chavez's cancer has 'entered the end stage' http://t.co/6VQf4krk
item.content:encoded: Report: Chavez's cancer has 'entered the end stage' http://t.co/6VQf4krk From Yahoo! News: This reporter has been told that Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez has metastatic rhabdomyosarcoma, an aggressive cancer that has "entered the end stage". The information and the quote come from a highly respected source close to Chavez and who is in a position to know his medical condition and history. This source says the prognosis is dire and that Chavez is now not expected to live "more than a couple of months at most." Chavez is running for re-elec tion in Venezuela but several sources--including the one who revealed the exact kind of cancer-- have told me that they believe it is doubtful the dictator will live to see the results. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: news.yahoo.com

item.content:encoded: Oops: BBC Mistakes 'Halo’ Logo For United Nations Emblem [VIDEO] http://t.co/dpCZZs5x RT @mashable A news clip from the BBC used a logo from the Halo video game series instead of the United Nations emblem. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: mashable.com

item.title: Salesforce Set to Snap Up Facebook Friend Buddy Media for More Than $800 Million
item.description: Salesforce Set to Snap Up Facebook Friend Buddy Media For More Than $800 Million -by @pkafka http://t.co/CHsU1N9w
item.content:encoded: Salesforce Set to Snap Up Facebook Friend Buddy Media For More Than $800 Million -by @pkafka http://t.co/CHsU1N9w The new must-have for enterprise software companies: A social media arm. Last week, Oracle grabbed Vitrue. Now it's Marc Benioff's turn. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: allthingsd.com
